type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

identifiers.description: Any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing.
identifiers.$comment:
Some identifiers have specific properties e.g the `issn` property for
the `Periodical` type. These should be used in preference to this
property which is intended for identifiers that do not yet have a
specific property. Identifiers can be represented as strings, but
using a `PropertyValue` will usually be better because it allows
for `propertyID` (i.e. the type of identifier).

anyOf.description: The author, usually a `Person`, imported content from an external format into a new document.
The author, usually a `Person`, wrote content including inserting, deleting and replacing prose and code.
The author, usually a `Person`, verified the accuracy of content, usually generated by a `SoftwareApplication`.
The author, usually a `Person`, instructed another author, usually a `SoftwareApplication`, to create content.
The author, usually a `SoftwareApplication`, prompted another author, also usually a `SoftwareApplication`, to generate content.
The author is a `SoftwareApplication` that generated content such as prose, code, or images.
